questions.text: How many bits are in an IPv4 address?
questions.explanation: IPv4 addresses are 32-bit integers.

questions.text: What does a subnet mask define?
questions.explanation: The subnet mask distinguishes the Network portion from the Host portion of the IP address.

questions.text: What type of address is used for one destination?
questions.explanation: Unicast is one-to-one communication.

questions.text: Who manages global IP address allocation?
questions.explanation: IANA (Internet Assigned Numbers Authority) manages global allocation.

questions.text: What is the function of NAT?
questions.explanation: NAT (Network Address Translation) translates private IP addresses to public IP addresses to conserve IPv4 space.

questions.text: What type of address is sent to all devices on a network?
questions.explanation: Broadcast frames/packets are processed by all devices in the broadcast domain.

questions.text: What does /16 represent in an IP address?
questions.explanation: It represents the subnet mask (CIDR notation), meaning the first 16 bits are the network.

questions.text: What decreases when the prefix length increases (e.g., from /24 to /26)?
questions.explanation: More bits for the network means fewer bits left for hosts.

questions.text: What is the process of dividing networks into smaller networks called?
questions.explanation: Subnetting is the practice of dividing a network into two or more smaller networks.

questions.text: What is the broadcast address of 192.168.10.0/26?
questions.explanation: /26 means block size is 64. Range is .0 to .63. Broadcast is the last IP: .63.

questions.text: How many usable hosts are in a /29 network?
questions.explanation: 32 - 29 = 3 host bits. 2^3 - 2 = 6 usable hosts.

questions.text: What is the subnet mask for /27?
questions.explanation: /27 means 3 bits borrowed in the last octet. 128+64+32 = 224.

questions.text: Find the network address for IP 10.10.5.34/24
questions.explanation: /24 means the first 3 octets are the network. Just zero out the last octet.

questions.text: Which subnet does 172.16.2.200 belong to if the mask is /20?
questions.explanation: /20 is 255.255.240.0. Block size in 3rd octet is 16. Ranges: 0-15, 16-31. 2 falls in 0-15. Network is 172.16.0.0.

questions.text: What is the first usable host in 192.168.1.128/25?
questions.explanation: Network address is .128. First usable is Network + 1 = .129.

questions.text: How many total IPs (including net/broadcast) are there in a /28 network?
questions.explanation: 32 - 28 = 4 bits. 2^4 = 16 total IPs.

questions.text: Find the broadcast address of 10.0.15.0/24
questions.explanation: For /24, the broadcast is always .255 in the last octet.

questions.text: What subnet mask gives 254 usable hosts?
questions.explanation: 254 hosts requires 8 host bits (2^8 - 2 = 254). This is a /24 mask.

questions.text: What is the last usable host in 192.168.2.64/26?
questions.explanation: /26 block size is 64. Range: .64 to .127. Broadcast is .127. Last usable is .126.

questions.text: Refer to the VLSM diagram (Network A needs 120 hosts, Link A needs 2 hosts). Which network addresses should be used for Link A and Network A? (Choose two)
questions.explanation: Network A needs 120 hosts -> /25 (128 IPs). Option B (172.16.3.128/25) fits. Link A needs 2 hosts -> /30. It must not overlap with Marketing (.32/27), Sales (.64/27), Admin (.96/27) or Net A (.128/25). Option D (172.16.3.0/30) uses range 0-3, which is free.

questions.text: Refer to the VLAN diagram. All hosts have connectivity. Which statements describe the addressing scheme? (Choose three)
questions.explanation: VLAN1 (84 hosts) and VLAN2 (114 hosts) both need /25 (128 IPs) because /26 (64 IPs) is too small. So mask is 255.255.255.128 (B). 172.16.1.25 fits in the first /25 block (0-127) for VLAN1 (C). The router connects two different networks/VLANs, so it must have multiple IP addresses (or subinterfaces) configured (F).

options.text: The subnet mask in use is 255.255.255.192
The subnet mask in use is 255.255.255.128
The IP address 172.16.1.25 can be assigned to hosts in VLAN1
The IP address 172.16.1.205 can be assigned to hosts in VLAN1
The LAN interface of the router is configured with one IP address
The LAN interface of the router is configured with multiple IP addresses
